qas.question: Why type of anthropology is the study of social organization a central focus of?
Why type of conflict is sociocultural anthropology interested in?
What patterns does sociocultural anthropology get up in the morning to learn about?
What is the object of study for linguistic anthropology?
What is the study of kinship and ancestory?
What type of anthropology covers the formation of conflict?

context: The study of kinship and social organization is a central focus of <b5_0>sociocultural anthropology<b5_0/>, as <a4_0>kinship<a4_0/> is a human universal. <a0_0><b6_0>Sociocultural<a0_0/> anthropology<b6_0/> also covers economic and political organization, law and conflict <a1_0>resolution<a1_0/>, patterns of <a2_0>consumption and exchange<a2_0/>, material culture, technology, infrastructure, gender relations, ethnicity, childrearing and socialization, religion, myth, symbols, values, etiquette, worldview, sports, music, nutrition, recreation, games, food, festivals, and <a3_0>language<a3_0/> (which is also the object of study in linguistic anthropology).
